Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <10 (Not Giving away Eth)> Is their a way to create a privacy coin, without exploits, by limiting the design? This includes any aspect of the coin--wallets, etc....

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <10 (Not Giving away Eth)> This isn't a criticism bc of recent events...
It just seems like widespread adoption requires a privacy project, to open itself up more to exploits..

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @10 (Not Giving away Eth) not sure what you mean... we have been devoid of exploits so far, while we know that it is a risk for any project whatsoever, we work hard to stay on top of things and to respond quickly if something is ever discovered. We also use and develop leading solutions to help keep it that way. do you have any particular exploit you're concerned about? are you referring to the one that hit Komodo Agama but not Verus Agama? Earlier Zcash sprout issues that we fixed before anyone else besides Zcash, or the 51% attacks that Verus is resistant to in multiple ways? Maybe fake stake or nothing at stake attacks that we have solutions for? Please let us know if there's a kind of exploit you feel would be something we need to look into related to our privacy capability or the zero knowledge support on PBaaS chains. I'm not aware of any weakness in those areas regarding Verus, but we are always looking üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <10 (Not Giving away Eth)> Mike, I never said anything of the sort.
It wasn't directed towards any project.
It was a general question, in general discussion.

I know, that projects like XMR & not until of very recent ZEC, had a mobile wallet. 
Why that is, I'm not one hundred percent sure.
I'm not an expert, nor am I a developer.
But it does seem that, in most things privacy tech related, that less can be better.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <10 (Not Giving away Eth)> This is a general privacy tech related comment, not directed at Verus, or Komodo or any privacy project.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <10 (Not Giving away Eth)> ___
I did find myself thinking about PBaaS & if it would be possible, to add another level of privacy, to a chain... Not that Verus doesn't offer the Gold Standard, in crypto... It was just a thought

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Akira X> so can i just use my existing verus address and send kmd stuff to them?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Akira X> why do i need to generate a new address?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <Gordon Komodo> if your verus address has never been used in the affected agama wallet, then it's fine @Akira X

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> @10 (Not Giving away Eth) There's an Albert Einstein quote, "things should be as simple as possible, but not simpler", that I think applies. There are many things to achieve with blockchain, and if it is pure privacy and sending of amounts only, you can achieve that most simply without other core capabilities. When you start to want other capabilities, like dapps, or staking, or cross-chain operations, or other advanced features, a provably private system may require more complexity, but it should still be kept as simple as possible, I believe. I don't think that means open to more exploits, but I may misunderstand what you mean.

Author: Gateway#3763
